text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a delicious grilled halibut
steak with chanterelle mushrooms sweet
corn some pepper some tarragon some
microgreens we will talk about those
later anyway great end of summer
beginning of fall meal and it started
with these super beautiful white
chantrelle now you're gonna be able to
find chanterelle in your fancier markets
this time of year or farmers market and
just make sure you scrape if there's any
dirt scrape it off wipe it off but you
know what if you're afraid of eating a
little dirt you shouldn't be eating
mushrooms okay so anyway don't be afraid
brush them off I cut it in nice big
thick slices usually for a dish like
this because it's gonna go with corn
I might have diced it to kind of match
the shapes but I'm glad I did I wanted a
bigger meteor bite so a little bit of
olive oil wetting that pan and on medium
heat with a nice pinch of salt I'm gonna
cook those mushrooms until they're
lightly Brown see so they're all like
that one so that took about ten minutes
all right up to you you can really
caramelize these really cook them well
done I have some fresh corn I sliced
right off a cob one year of corn about a
cup you can use frozen if you have to
and I have a little bit of diced roasted
red pepper these are the Spanish
piquillo peppers that I love but if you
want to you can use any red pepper or
dice up a red bell yourself all right
after the mushrooms are nicely browned
and just about cooked through I'm gonna
add my corn and pepper mixture all right
after toasting the corn in the pan for
about 2-3 minutes I'm gonna add about a
half a cup of water now the sudden went
behind a cloud and the color got weird
here so I apologize but that'll happen
okay so the water goes in we're gonna
simmer this for about five minutes just
to reduce it a little bit to finish this
extremely simple side dish I threw in a
chunk of butter and the juice of half a
lemon and that was it so simple because
chanterelles are so earthy and meaty and
delicious and the sweet corn and the
slightly bitter sweet pepper perfect
combination you don't have to do too
much so I'm gonna put that on just
really low heat it's got a little bit of
liquid left to it but that's fine
leave that on low while i grill my
beautiful wild Pacific halibut steaks
alright I hope you can get halibut where
you live because it's a great meaty
meaty firm nice whitefish now it was
raining outside so I didn't bring my
camera out so I took pictures this is me
grilling halibut about four minutes
aside just salt and pepper a little bit
of oil brushed on so simple and then it
was time to eat since the mushroom and
corn mixture had been on that low heat
for about I don't know ten minutes while
I grilled the fish it was just about
perfect
you need to crank up the heat reduce the
rest of the liquid you can but I'd like
a little bit of juice on there
and then very important before we put
our fish down I hit it with some freshly
chopped tarragon see I didn't want to
cook that into the mixture because I
wanted it really fresh and sweet tasting
and smelling so put your tarragon in
right before you put the fish down some
lemon and a big well not that big a
handful of microgreens
now you might hear chefs on TV making
fun of microgreens yes because they're
totally overused and pretty much the
cliche now but hey I haven't used them
all summer so here they totally made
sense
tiny tiny baby arugula in this case
really finish the dish perfectly so this
was a really nice simple but delicious
fall meal the earthy mushrooms sweet
corn underneath that slightly smoky
grilled halibut just a great dinner that
mushroom and corn bass will work under
just about any kind of grilled meat so
give it a try all the ingredients are on
the site and as always enjoy
